definition: Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
winter
to arrive/most/to/until
the winter solstice

sentences.english: Remarkably, the total lunar eclipse coincided with the date of the December Solstice.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，這次月全食恰好發生在冬至日。

sentences.english: Hogmanay is derived from the winter solstice festival celebrated by the Vikings.
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜是來自冬至節由維京慶祝。

sentences.english: But on the Winter Solstice, he had no appetite for the whole table of nice dishes of every kind.
sentences.chinese: 冬至節，看着滿桌的山珍海味卻一點兒胃口也沒有了。

sentences.english: Afterwards, Zhang Zhongjing died on the day of winter solstice.
sentences.chinese: 後來，張仲景在冬至那天去世。

sentences.english: Visible, Shu third day after the winter solstice was December day.
sentences.chinese: 可見，冬至後第三個戍日曾是臘日。

sentences.english: In the Winter Solstice day, the two people invite Hu Yin to have supper with dumpling and drink.
sentences.chinese: 很快到了冬至，鬼冬那天，二人留胡公子喫餃子。

sentences.english: Then when was the last time that we had a total lunar eclipse occur on the same date as the winter solstice?
sentences.chinese: 那麼上一次人類在冬至時節看到月全食是什麼時候呢？

sentences.english: The rowdy Roman harvest festival at winter solstice became Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 比如在冬至日，熱鬧的羅馬豐收節就成了聖誕節。

sentences.english: This means that the Earth moves faster along the orbit in winter near perihelion .
sentences.chinese: 這意味着地球在靠近冬至點附近的冬季運行得較快。

sentences.english: After the Winter Solstice, days will become longer and longer.
sentences.chinese: 冬至以後，文天就會一每天變長。

sentences.english: Like a blaze of summer straw, in winter's nick.
sentences.chinese: 象夏日麥杆的燃燒，在冬至時節。

sentences.english: This eclipse is about to fall on the solstice, which gives it much more influence.
sentences.chinese: 這次月偏食即將落在冬至，這使得它的影響更大。

sentences.english: We have not had an eclipse on a solstice since 2001.
sentences.chinese: 我們還沒有一日食一冬至2001年以來。

sentences.english: This day was supposed to represent the midpoint between the Winter Solstice and the Spring Equinox.
sentences.chinese: 這一天本來是代表介於冬至到春曉的中界點。

sentences.english: Time passed fast. On the date of Winter solstice, they got together and had dumplings to celebrate this holiday.
sentences.chinese: 很快到了冬至，鬼冬那天，二人留胡公子喫餃子。

sentences.english: Every year ham is made between the winter solstice and the great cold of the Chinese lunar calendar.
sentences.chinese: 每年冬至到大寒，是老黃父子製作火腿的最佳時間。

definition: see 冬至[Dong1 zhi4]
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
solar term
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
Great Cold, 24th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 20th January-3rd February
the 24 solar terms, calculated from the position of the sun on the ecliptic, that divide the year into 24 equal periods
Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Lesser Cold, 23rd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-19th January
Shuangjiang or Frost Descends, 18th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd October-6th November
lunar New Year's Eve
twelfth lunar month
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August
